title: Great, but not THAT scary. **CONTAINS MILD SPOILER**
review: While I did think that the Blair Witch Project was a very goodmovie, I didn't think it was overall as scary as all the reviewshad said.  Granted, it had its moments of undeniable terror,such as the scene in the tent when a mysterious force beganpounding on the tent, and in the background you could hearchildren laughing and singing.  I liked the fact that it had amildly humerous tone to it, like Mike's comment about redneckswhen the trio discovered the stick figures in the t

title: Wow.
review: Without a doubt, The Shawshank Redemption is one of the absolute best movies that I have ever seen.  Seeing a movie with characters that seem so true to life that I could actually care for them was a rare and very welcome experience for me.  The film was made in such a way that you didn't really know how it was going to end, but what an ending indeed.  I thought it was one of the most rewarding endings to a movie in recent history. I don't know how this movie was passed up for an Academy Award for best picture, or at least a nomination, amazes me.  Well deserving of its rank of #4 in the top 250 movies of all time.

title: Pretty cool, but definately could've been better...
review: I think that The Sixth Sense had many redeeming qualities, starting with strong performances by both Bruce Willis and Haley Joel Osment.  I think that the end twist with Bruce Willis's character was a great idea, and unpredictable.  I also liked the particular interaction that Osment's character had with the ghosts.  What I didn't like was that I don't think it was developed enough.  Director m. Night Shyalaman was onto two very interesting plot elements, and if they had been developed a bit more, this film would have been much better.
